tweet: Standing with striking @UAW workers on the picket line in Bay City. Workers are ready to go back to work building world-class cars. They deserve a fair contract! pic.twitter.com/O8LzGduEQg

I stand in solidarity with these workers on strike. pic.twitter.com/v6qad4cYtf

Our country is at a moment of truth. 

Will my Republican colleagues stand up to defend the rule of law and our Constitution, or will they continue to do a gymnastics routine to defend this President’s lawlessness? pic.twitter.com/IF0iDEEYJJ

The American people now have clear evidence that President Trump put his own political interest over the national security of the country. 

Pressuring a foreign government to investigate a political opponent is unlawful and an abuse of power. pic.twitter.com/pet74RXYDH

This is a solemn day in our nation’s history. Opening an impeachment inquiry against the President of the United States should always be a tool of last resort, but sadly this is a step we must take to uphold and defend our Constitution.
Sadly, this is only the latest corrupt action by @realDonaldTrump, who has regularly lied to the American people, obstructed congressional oversight and ignored the Constitution.

If the President used his office to pressure a foreign government to investigate a political opponent, it is unlawful and an abuse of power. In doing so, the President has put America’s national security at risk in order to advance his own narrow personal interests.
Sadly, @realDonaldTrump has taken us to this moment where the opening of an impeachment inquiry is necessary to defend the rule of law.
